>
[True Name Amulet](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1083)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 247 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn amulet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This amulet bears the true name of a single creature with a level no higher than the item's level. These amulets are typically made of gold and engraved, but could be made of anything, including simple clay. The name is clearly visible, though only to you, and only while you have the amulet invested.

If you can read the language in which the name is written, that creature always takes the effects of [_invoke true name_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1065) against your spells (with a spell level equal to half the item's level, rounded up). In addition, when the creature uses any magical effect against you, you can immediately attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) it using [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Nature](/Domains.aspx?ID=22), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), or [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) for the counteract check and the _true name amulet's_ level to determine the counteract level. Legendary amulets bearing the true names of creatures of level 21+ may exist.
